intro: Elatostema gillespiei, commonly known as the dwarf snowflake, is a small, herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related species. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a frosty appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Elatostema gillespiei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices.
